func.title: GetPlayerControlAssignment

param.name: player
param.desc: Number of the player for whom the control set is queried.

param.name: control
param.desc: Control to query. A CON_* constant should be used here.

param.name: human_readable
param.desc: If true, some internal names such as JOY_* for joystick buttons are replaced by variants suitable for display to the player.

param.name: short_name
param.desc: If true, short names are preferred if available. Currently effects Mac builds only.

func.desc: Returns the name of the key, mouse of joystick button assigned to a control for a player. If the player number is invalid, nil is returned. For unassigned or invalid controls, "" is returned.
func.remark: For network games and replays, the returned value is not synchronized. If the function is called for a remote player or during replay, "" is always returned for valid player numbers.
In 9.0 OC this function was deprecated because it can be retrieved from the player directly via GetPlayer and GetControlAssignment.

example.code: Message("Press <c ffff00>%s</c> to walk left!", GetPlayer(GetPlayerByIndex(0, C4PT_User))->GetControlAssignment(CON_Left, true, true));
example.text: Tells the first player how to walk left.
